glycolic acid,
hydroxyacetic acid | Section1 = {{Chembox Identifiers DrugBank_Ref = DrugBank = DB03085 ChEBI_Ref = | ChEBI = 17497 SMILES = C(C(=O)O)O UNII_Ref = UNII = 0WT12SX38S KEGG_Ref = KEGG | = C03547 InChI = 1/C2H4O3/c3-1-2(4)5/h3H,1H2,(H,4,5) InChIKey = AEMRFAOFKBGASW- | UHFFFAOYAR ChEMBL_Ref = ChEMBL = 252557 StdInChI_Ref = StdInChI = 1S/C2H4O3/c3-1- | 2(4)5/h3H,1H2,(H,4,5) StdInChIKey_Ref = StdInChIKey = AEMRFAOFKBGASW-UHFFFAOYSA- | N CASNo = 79-14-1 CASNo_Ref = ChemSpiderID_Ref = ChemSpiderID = 737 RTECS = | MC5250000 }} | Section2 = {{Chembox Properties Formula = | C2H4O3 MolarMass = 76.05 g/mol Appearance = | white, powdery solid Density = 1.27 g/cm3 Solubility = 70% solution | Solvent = other solvents SolubleOther = alcohols, acetone,
acetic acid | and
ethyl acetate MeltingPt = 75 °C BoilingPt = | decomposes pKa = 3.83 Viscosity = }} | Section3 = {{Chembox Structure CrystalStruct = Dipole = }} | Section7 = {{Chembox Hazards ExternalMSDS = MainHazards = Corrosive ('C') NFPA- | H = 3 NFPA-F = 1 NFPA-R = FlashPt = 129 °C RPhrases = | - SPhrases = -- }} | Section8 = {{Chembox Related Function = α-hydroxy acids OtherFunctn = lactic | acid OtherCpds = acetic acid,
glycerol }} }} 'Glycolic acid' (or 'hydroxyacetic acid') is the smallest α-hydroxy acid (AHA). This colorless, odorless, and hygroscopic crystalline solid is highly soluble in water. It is used in various skin-care products. Glycolic acid is found in some sugar-crops.
